intro: Tetramolopium vagans, commonly known as the wandering tetramolopium, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and hairy foliage. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open plains. Its small, yellowish flowers are arranged in clusters, and the leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs. Tetramolopium vagans is known for its ability to thrive in harsh conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
